alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Macon; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Bullock, Macon and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1244 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated rainfall amounts between 2 and 5 inches have fallen. Heavy rain has ended but light to moderate rainfall will continue to to the potential for urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Montgomery, Pike Road, Shorter, Waugh, Mount Meigs, Auburn University In Montgomery, Pinedale, Cecil, Mitchell, Cross Keys, Barachias and Simsville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
